items.title: Egyptian dissident should be deported from UK, Tories say
items.description: Alaa Abdel Fattah flew to the UK on Friday after a travel ban imposed by Cairo was lifted.

items.title: Ex-England batter and ECB boss Morris dies
items.description: Hugh Morris, the former England and Glamorgan batter and England and Wales Cricket Board chief executive, has died at the age of 62.

items.title: 'Devoted' dad dies after assault outside pub
items.description: Police launched a murder inquiry after David Darke, 66, died in hospital days after an assault.

items.title: French cinema actress Brigitte Bardot dies aged 91
items.description: The actress was a symbol of sexual liberation in the 1950s but became increasingly controversial after making homophobic and racist slurs.

items.title: Three killed in Sweden as major storm sweeps across Nordic countries
items.description: Thousands of homes in parts of Finland, Sweden and Norway have been left without power.
